billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Establishes a class E felony for the sale to a minor of an alcoholic beverage containing a stimulant when such sale is made by a licensee of the state liquor authority
summary: Establishes a class E felony for the sale to a minor of an alcoholic beverage containing a stimulant when such sale is made by a licensee of the state liquor authority.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2842

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   February 2, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens.  KLEIN, VALESKY -- read twice and ordered printed,
         and when printed to be committed to the  Committee  on  Investigations
         and Government Operations

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  alcoholic  beverage control law, in relation to
         providing enhanced penalties for licensees who sell certain  alcoholic
         beverages to persons under the age of twenty-one years

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 65 of the alcoholic beverage control law is amended
    2  by adding a new subdivision 3-a read as follows:
    3    3-A. ANY LICENSEE, OR ITS AGENT OR EMPLOYEE, WHO  SELLS,  DELIVERS  OR
    4  GIVES  AWAY,  OR  CAUSES,  PERMITS  OR PROCURES TO BE SOLD, DELIVERED OR
    5  GIVEN AWAY TO ANY PERSON, ACTUALLY OR APPARENTLY, UNDER THE AGE OF TWEN-
    6  TY-ONE YEARS, ANY ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE THAT   CONTAINS MORE THAN  TWO  PER
    7  CENTUM  OF  ALCOHOL BY VOLUME, IN COMBINATION WITH MORE THAN FIVE MILLI-
    8  GRAMS PER OUNCE OF CAFFEINE OR ANY OTHER STIMULANT  INCLUDING,  BUT  NOT
    9  LIMITED TO, GUARANA, GINSENG OR TAURINE THAT HAS AN EQUIVALENT EFFECT AS
   10  SUCH  QUANTITY  OF  CAFFEINE,  SHALL  BE  GUILTY  OF A CLASS E FELONY AS
   11  DEFINED IN THE PENAL LAW.
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect on the thirtieth day  after  it  shall
   13  have become a law.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05015-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation to providing enhanced penalties for licensees who sell certain alcoholic beverages to persons under the age of twenty-one years
